content.body: foolip: I think that makes sense
I'll run a new query for all of httparchive, with pi targets [a-zA-Z][a-zA-Z0-9-]* , excluding "xml"
zcorpan: if we define pseudo-attribute conformance properly (and it's implemented by validator.nu) do you think that changes the calculus for > vs ?> in serialization and conformance requirements?
content.formatted_body: zcorpan: if we define pseudo-attribute conformance properly (and it's implemented by validator.nu) do you think that changes the calculus for > vs ?> in serialization and conformance requirements?

content.body: foolip: I'm ok with > if the serializer omits ?. I suppose the lack of HTML parser-level parse error means some people will miss errors, but it's probably a small set of people anyway (who use an HTML parser in their pipeline but not validator.nu)
content.formatted_body: foolip: I'm ok with > if the serializer omits ?. I suppose the lack of HTML parser-level parse error means some people will miss errors, but it's probably a small set of people anyway (who use an HTML parser in their pipeline but not validator.nu)

content.body: I've been looking at how to define conformance. I think it would be something analagous to "The value attribute, if specified and not empty, must have a value that is a valid time string."
zcorpan: could we report parse errors without actually parsing?
content.formatted_body: zcorpan: could we report parse errors without actually parsing?

content.body: foolip: would need to step through new pseudo-attribute states in the tokenizer to get it right. It's overkill for just reporting errors from the parser
content.formatted_body: foolip: would need to step through new pseudo-attribute states in the tokenizer to get it right. It's overkill for just reporting errors from the parser

Noam Rosenthal: After checking a few URLs for xml-stylesheet, it seems the data includes JS resources even though the query tried to only include resources with type "html". e.g. https://instructor.go-red.co.uk/ has the matching PI in https://instructor.go-red.co.uk/portal/instructor/Login.aspx?_TSM_CombinedScripts_=True&v=ZaMfZ6yYhPPHZ1NeEf8j6-t902-6pHpn2MehV0eep-I1&_TSM_Bundles_=&cdn=False

foolip: 
```
SELECT COUNT(DISTINCT page) FROM `httparchive.crawl.pages` WHERE date = "2026-01-01"
AND client = "desktop"
```
20727999

https://html.spec.whatwg.org/#concept-optgroup-label has the phrase "descendants of descendants of the `legend`", which seems odd. Note that it skips children of the `legend` (because, while they're descendants of the legend, they aren't descendants of descendants of the legend), but it seems like you wouldn't want to skip them.
content.formatted_body: https://html.spec.whatwg.org/#concept-optgroup-label has the phrase "descendants of descendants of the legend", which seems odd. Note that it skips children of the legend (because, while they're descendants of the legend, they aren't descendants of descendants of the legend), but it seems like you wouldn't want to skip them.

content.body: * https://html.spec.whatwg.org/#concept-optgroup-label has the phrase "descendants of descendants of the `legend`", which seems odd. Note that it omits children of the `legend` (because, while they're descendants of the legend, they aren't descendants of descendants of the legend), but it seems like you wouldn't want to omit them. (omit them from the exclusion, that is)

content.body: * https://html.spec.whatwg.org/#concept-optgroup-label has the phrase "excluding any that are descendants of descendants of the `legend`", and that "desc. of desc." seems odd. Note that it fails to exclude children of the `legend` (because, while they're descendants of the legend, they aren't descendants of descendants of the legend), but it seems like you do want to exclude them.
content.formatted_body: * https://html.spec.whatwg.org/#concept-optgroup-label has the phrase "excluding any that are descendants of descendants of the legend", and that "desc. of desc." seems odd. Note that it fails to exclude children of the legend (because, while they're descendants of the legend, they aren't descendants of descendants of the legend), but it seems like you do want to exclude them.
